Recent updates from New York City include a pit bull attack on a toddler, a car crash injuring pedestrians, a salmonella outbreak linked to raw oysters, and a major cheese recall affecting multiple states. Additionally, NYC's homicide rate is on track for a near-record low in 2025.

### Risks & Alerts

- Pit Bull attacks 1-year-old on NYC street; video available. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Three people injured after a car slams into a building and strikes pedestrians in Queens. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Salmonella outbreak linked to raw oysters reported in New York and other states. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiogFBVV95cUxQR2lKR1Jfd2hrQUFiclpQV3FFLXFUOHJkOUxKOTU0QW1tVl90YlRvWVk2aUtDR1pXbmtBNVBqUkZ6YXlwMVdFWWRGbERpSVM5R3duX0RzbE05LXBBREZJUml3YWkzSTdHYkpYMVJqclV0WjdpZ1M0Ry02TnZ4dHA3bjJoOXY2bDlFQ1ZsWmw5MGFZN0xJOWtDM2hEME9udVU1aWc?oc=5)
- Major cheese product recalled in New York and 30 other states; sold at Walmart and Target. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
